== Prerequirement
  You have postgis installed and configured.

  You have topojson installed:
    1) install node.js and npm (http://nodejs.org/)

    2)
      uninstall if have old one installed: `npm uninstall topojson -g`
      `git clone git://github.com/rainchen/topojson.git`
      `git checkout -b add_geojson_bin origin/add_geojson_bin`
      `cd topojson`
      `npm install . -g`
   3) Mac OSX with PostgresApp
      If you gen an pg gem error find the pg_config file and set it on --with-pc-config
          sudo find / -name pg_config
          gem install pg -- --with-pg-config=/Applications/Postgres.app/Contents/MacOS/bin/pg_config
     ERROR: `rescue in <module:FFIGeos>': Couldn't load the GEOS CAPI library. (LoadError)
       Solution:
          brew install geos
  4) This is need to convert shape files to GeoJSON
       http://www.kyngchaos.com/software/frameworks
       get GDAL 1.9 Complete
       simlink ogr2ogr to bin
       ln -s /Library/Frameworks/GDAL.framework/Programs/ogr2ogr /usr/local/bin/

== Setup
1) install gems:
  bundle install

2) create super db user
  createuser --pwprompt --superuser pointsinarea
  If you get this error:
    Is the server running locally and accepting connections on Unix domain socket "/var/pgsql_socket/.s.PGSQL.5432"?
  You can fix this issue by not using the socket, but just conneting to the host:
    createuser -h localhost --pwprompt --superuser pointsinarea



3) setup db
  rake db:create
  rake db:migrate

4) start server
  rails s

5) go http://localhost:3000/ and create 2 layers, using the files in public/geojson_sammple dir:
  Single Polygon(Hottingen):
  public/geojson_sample/210609.geojson

  Multi Polygon(New York City):
  public/geojson_sample/85090.geojson

6) then you can try the api call links:
    - a point in New York City
    - multi points

== Specs
   To run test execute 'rake spec' in root folder
